intro: Calyptrogyne condensata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific and Indian Oceans. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows near coastal areas, thriving in saline or brackish environments. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves that are narrow and slightly serrated. Its flowers are showy, with five petals that range in color from white to pink, and they bloom in clusters. Calyptrogyne condensata is adapted to withstand salt spray and is often found in mangrove swamps or tidal flats.
